workout_title: Beginner Chest, Shoulder, and Triceps Blast

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Slowly rotate your shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then reverse the direction and rotate backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Clasp your hands behind your back and gently straighten your arms, feeling a stretch across your chest. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat 2 times.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Raise one arm overhead and bend your elbow, letting your hand fall behind your head. Gently pull your elbow toward your head with your other hand. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat on the other side. Repeat 2 times.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading your legs and raising your arms overhead. Return to starting position. Perform for 30 seconds.

exercises.setup: Adjust the machine seat so that your back is comfortably supported against the backrest.  Position yourself so that when you extend your arms, the handles are at chest height.  Grab the handles with a firm grip, palms facing each other.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably on the machine with your back against the backrest. Grab the handles with a firm grip, palms facing each other. Extend your arms fully, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
2. Lower the Handles: Slowly lower the handles towards your chest, keeping your back flat against the backrest. Inhale as you lower the handles.
3. Press the Handles: Once the handles reach your chest, press them back to the starting position, exhaling as you do so. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Continue performing the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase the weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with an overhand grip. Unrack the bar and hold it above your chest.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with an overhand grip. Unrack the bar and hold it above your chest.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the bar towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent. Inhale as you lower the bar.
3. Press the Bar: Once the bar touches your chest, press it back up to the starting position, exhaling as you do so. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Continue performing the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Ensure the bar touches your chest and you maintain a stable position throughout the movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid bouncing the weight or using momentum to complete the reps.

exercises.setup: Adjust the bench to an incline position (around 30-45 degrees). Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Extend your arms fully, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
2. Lower the Dumbbells: Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent. Inhale as you lower the dumbbells.
3. Press the Dumbbells: Once the dumbbells reach your chest, press them back up to the starting position, exhaling as you do so. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Continue performing the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase the weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the cable machine to a height that allows you to sit comfortably. Sit on the machine and hold the handles with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably on the machine with your back straight. Hold the handles with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Extend your arms fully in front of you.
2. Bring the Handles Together: Slowly bring the handles together in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles. Inhale as you bring the handles together.
3. Return to Starting Position: Slowly return the handles to the starting position, exhaling as you do so. Focus on maintaining tension in your chest muscles throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Continue performing the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form. Focus on a controlled movement and a full range of motion.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid using momentum to complete the reps.

exercises.setup: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width. Keep your elbows slightly bent.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width. Keep your elbows slightly bent.
2. Press the Barbell: Press the barbell straight overhead, fully extending your arms. Exhale as you press the barbell.
3. Lower the Barbell: Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, inhaling as you lower it. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Continue performing the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase the weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid using momentum to complete the reps.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms fully extended overhead, holding the bar attachment with an overhand grip.
2. Lower the Bar: Keeping your upper arms stationary, bend your elbows and lower the bar behind your head. Inhale as you lower the bar.
3. Extend Your Arms: Extend your arms back to the starting position, fully extending your elbows. Exhale as you extend your arms.
4. Repeat: Continue performing the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase the weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Lower the bar to your forehead.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Lower the bar to your forehead.
2. Lower the Bar: Keeping your upper arms stationary, lower the bar towards your forehead, bending your elbows. Inhale as you lower the bar.
3. Extend Your Arms: Extend your arms back to the starting position, fully extending your elbows. Exhale as you extend your arms.
4. Repeat: Continue performing the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Ensure a controlled movement and full range of motion.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid using momentum to complete the reps.

exercises.setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close grip (slightly narrower than shoulder-width), with an overhand grip. Unrack the bar and hold it above your chest.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close grip (slightly narrower than shoulder-width), with an overhand grip. Unrack the bar and hold it above your chest.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the bar towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Inhale as you lower the bar.
3. Press the Bar: Once the bar touches your chest, press it back up to the starting position, exhaling as you do so. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Continue performing the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase the weight gradually in subsequent workouts.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to the cable machine's low pulley. Stand facing the machine, gripping the bar with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing the cable machine, gripping the bar with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Extend your arms fully.
2. Lower the Bar: Keeping your upper arms stationary, pull the bar down towards your thighs, bending your elbows. Inhale as you lower the bar.
3. Extend Your Arms: Extend your arms back to the starting position, fully extending your elbows. Exhale as you extend your arms.
4. Repeat: Continue performing the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form. Maintain a controlled movement and full range of motion.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid using momentum to complete the reps.
